page.title: 19SCHOOLS
page.content:
{St. Edmund Campion School}was opened in January 1974 with 65 children. Now there are 241 pupils in 8 classes, 5 junior classes and 3 infant classes. Pupils are aged 5-11 and come from West Bridgford, Keyworth, Cotgrave, Bingham, Carlton, Radcliffe-on-Trent and Edwalton. Buses are used to transport some of the children. The school is mainly for Catholic children. The school buildings are in two permanent blocks
and two Porta-Kabins. School meals are supplied by Rushcliffe Comprehensive School. Most pupils go on to the Becket School when they leave. Next to it is{Abbey Road Primary {School}which was opened in January 1966. There are now 340 pupils. There are 8 junior and 5 infant classes. The children all live in West Bridgford.
